ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course is terrific for incoming graduate students in Sociology at Yale.
I would recommend this course to fellow students. I think this course is a great way for students to get to know department faculty and learn more about academia.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I feel as though I have a much better idea of who potential advisors may be in this department as well as courses I may want to take within and outside my areas of interest.
- Good overview of faculty interests, helpful in determining faculty to work with on the dissertation or other projects.

This course certainly helped me to learn more about academia, particularly what is needed to succeed on the competitive job market. In hearing about faculty members' research, the course also helped me to think more about my research and how I might make use of the many available resources in the department and the university more broadly.
